intro: Xyris reptans, commonly known as the creeping marsh yelloweye, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are grass-like and narrow, while its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Xyris reptans is often found in swampy areas and is an important part of the wetland ecosystem.
